Handoff enables me to prepare myself and carry out my evening tasks before people show up without worrying if I‚Äôll have an ample supply of spirits for my guests. With delivery guaranteed in under an hour, this is a perfect on-semand service for my on-demand lifestyle. I‚Äôve ordered everything from the Handoff wine recommendation  to my favorite bottle of bourbon without any delivery confusion. I‚Äôll continue to use Handoff‚Äôs excellent and convenient service.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2018

I love learning something new everyday. I look forward to tomorrow's episode.  Thanks Jenny!!!

title: Wente Vineyards is a great choice for my first Alexa-enabled virtual tasting!
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2020
content: Great selection of wines -- Wente Riva Ranch Vineyard Chardonnay, Wente Vineyards Southern Hills Cabernet Sauvignon and Wente Vineyards Morning Fog Chardonnay.  Fun history of the family and general overview of the vineyard regions.  Just enough technical detail to keep me engaged and the tasting notes are spot on.

title: Loved hearing the story and a fun way to learn about wine
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2020
content: What a fun and unique opportunity to utilize with Alexa!!  I really enjoyed learning about the history of Wente and going through and tasting the wine.  It would be better if I could have a way to purchase the wines via Amazon Fresh or PrimeNow.  Hope to see more of these in the future.

title: Wente Vineyards nails it!
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2020
content: I truly enjoyed taking my neighbors who are savvy wine geeks through this virtual tasting this afternoon. Very informative, engaging and the three wines Wente Vineyards featured Morning Fog Chardonnay, Riva Ranch Chardonnay and their delicious Southern Hills Cabernet Sauvignon were outstanding and paired well with our appetizers. I'm a fan for life! Make Time to experience this great new tasting platform.

title: Fun and Interactive! Great wine too!

title: Disappointing range and interface, but has potential
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2018
content: The range of dishes covered seems both small and odd.  The range of recommendations is limited and seems to focus on very basic choices, like the kind of meat being served, as opposed to being able to recognize specific recipes.  In a test of "not usually with wine" foods, it had a recommendation for tacos, but not for either hamburgers or hot dogs.  When you stump the interface, which is often, it won't stop asking if it can recommend something else . . . no matter what you say.  You have to say something like "Alexa, stop", which is just bad, sloppy programming.  OTOH, when it works it gives a short, to the point answer with a little bit of flair; if they can expand the menu items covered and tweak the interface, it would be a nice skill, so I'm going to keep it for awhile and hope they're still working on it.

title: Lots of potential, but far from practical
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2020
content: I wanted to like it‚Ä¶ but it‚Äôs not practical. A good idea, but you guys have to go back to the drawing board. To start with, the fact it has to give me instructions on how to use the skill EVERY time is quite annoying. And I have to wait it to stop speaking before I can voice any new commands. Second, I wanted something that would guide me through my recipes: this skill seemed to be it, but I have to pause it during the instructions, while I follow them ‚Äî and sometimes it just quits and I have to restart the whole thing until I got to the point where it had stopped (remember the annoying talking? Yes, I have to go through them all over again). To make it better, get rid of the instructions on how to use the skill, unless I need them (‚ÄúAlexa, walk me through the skill‚Äù or something). Then, allow me to say ‚Äúnext‚Äù while it‚Äôs still speaking. And finally, allow me some minutes before I say ‚Äúnext‚Äù: don‚Äôt just quit the skill and have me restart it from step zero. Again, I really wanted to like this skill‚Ä¶

title: A Good Echo Show Recipe Keeper
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2019
content: Having tried several recipe programs on my new Echo Show 8 the RecipeSpeak skill is by far the easiest to enter my personal recipes in. Entering my personal recipes was very easy and straightforward: just cut and paste. The skill was easy to link with (you need a free RecipeSpeak account) and easy to call up. Showing all of the ingredients for a given recipe in small font and the specific ingredient being discussed in large font is helpful. The commands to move around/through the recipe are easy. Having a printable voice command guide made getting up and running simple.  The skill accurately translates the printed recipe into verbal directions. I have not tried downloading a recipe from the internet, so I have no opinion on that feature.There are two reasons for the 4 versus 5 stars:1 - When stepping through the instructions it only shows the current one. Frequently I plan ahead when working on a recipe; the RecipeSpeak skill should show the current instruction plus 3-4 following steps.2 - Frequently the description section of my recipes has tips and tricks for preparing the item. The RecipeSpeak skill doesn't seem to have an option to see the 'Description' section of the recipe even though you can add it in on the website.I forwarded several suggestions to the support staff and received a nice, and prompt, note from them in reply.Overall I am quite pleased with this skill and look forward to using it more often.Update: I received an email from the RecipeSpeak support people; they implemented my first suggestion. For me, at least, this improved the skill's usability. I am bumping the rating to 5 star based on support staff communication and skill improvements.  I look forward to other options being added in the future.

title: Tedious and mostly useless.
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2018
content: I'm not impressed, and I'm very disappointed that this is the only such skill app that lets you use your own recipes. There's no way to add an image or photo of the food or ingredients or process. It defaults to listing the ingredients one by one, and forcing you to say "next" just to go to the next ingredient on the list. I found out you CAN say "show me all the ingredients" and it will do so, but you can't actually view the recipe. So all this does is store ingredients, and in the most tedious way possible.Someone really needs to come up with something better. I want to be able to access my stored recipes. I don't care about skill apps for recipe websites if my recipes aren't there. Being able to call up and view my recipes was the main reason I bought the Show to begin with. I thought that would be an intuitive thing for the maker to include.

title: Great
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 26, 2020
content: I like it so far, using it on my tablet. Three improvements: ability to turn off the command guide during the recipe (no more next or pause instruction before you can actually answer). Assume "pause" is the command after each step, since the user response to move to the next step is the same - music could automatically start after a set period of time has passed without a command. And allow alexa to answer non-recipespeak questions and commands and then return to the recipe, without havng to exit and restart recipespeak. I wanted to know if green beans should be stored in water, but in order for alexa to answer, I first had to exit recipespeak in the middle of my recipe, re-ask about grean beans, reopen recipespeak, find my recipe again, and go through all the steps until I reached my place in the recipe again. What a pain! All of these improvements would create a better user experience.

title: Best game in town so far
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2019
content: Maybe they improved it because I had no problem setting up the account, linking it, entering a simple recipe online, and getting Alexa to repeat it back within 15 minutes. It reads out the list of ingredients one by one but it now only prompts you to say 'next' after the first item.  Additional inbstructions have been added that make navigating the GUI more friendly, including the ability to list ALL ingredients, add items to your Alexa shopping list.  They now have a "cheat sheet" at recipespeak.com that lists all the voice commands you can use and allow you to enter aURL, if you have one, that Recipe Speak can import. It would be cool if Recipe Speak could open dxz files instead of me having to copy/paste them all from my now-unsupported Living Cookbook.

title: It works, that's all I need!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2020
content: I just got an Echo Show for my kitchen. Come to find that it does NOT allow you to see your personal recipes from AllRecipes.com, that skill is just plain broken, and it appears that they do not care.  So I found this great little skill and it is working for me!  Sure I wish that I could add a photo or it did this instead of that. BUT you do realize that they are providing you this service COMPLETELY FREE to you right?  Just the ability to add your personal recipe on their server for you to access anytime AND it works on the Echo Show.  That makes it 5 stars in my book.

title: Personal Recipes on Echo Show 8
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2020

Super easy to add my recipes through the Recipe Speak website (on my computer), even adding recipes from websites and then adding my own tweaks which I greatly appreciate. Did a quick test on Echo and seems to work well. Will take me a little time to learn the voice commands but there's a guide provided on the website. Looking forward to using the app.

title: Reads the recipe, does not show the recipe
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2019
content: I don't use the echo show, but I understand why people who do might be disappointed.  I also don't use other online recipe subscriptions, which I gather are not compatible with this skill.I do cut-and-paste recipes that I would like to use, and for those, it works quite well.  The ingredient list is not particularly useful, but you can say "Go to Steps" and the steps work quite well.  When I am setting up the recipe, I paste the quantities from the ingredient list into the relevant spot in the steps.  Then, I don't have to switch back and forth, and I am saved from the perpetual question" "Wait, how much chili powder again?"  I can have it repeat that step again and again, so I can also be reminded how much cumin, coriander, oregano, and will be reminded not to forget the salt.  That works pretty well when my hands are covered with flour or something, like the timer functions also work well when cooking.

title: Alexa app works well for immediate brewing
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2018
content: Echoing a lot of the other comments on this review board.  It works pretty well when I wake up and tell Behmor to run Quickstart or Brew my Coffee.  Alexa gets the command right about 75% of the time, but there are other times it does not understand me (I don't have this issue with other Alexa commands).  But like a lot of other reviewers, I would like to see Alexa integrated more so that it can be part of a routine, e.g. Alexa start my morning, and Alexa would turn on some lights, turn up the thermostat, start some music, and start the Behmor.  Also, regarding the delayed start of Behmor, for now, I use my phone app to do that, not Alexa, so that skill is not crucial.  But the Routine feature would definitely be useful.  Hope Behmor can do more work to integrate with Alexa (it is a Behmor issue and impetus to program, not Alexa).

title: App a bit clunky and no future schedule thru Alexa
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2018
content: I love the coffee it brews and I found that connecting Alexa and the Behmor was straightforward.  The Behmor app is pretty clunky and after several days of support efforts with both Behmor and Amazon, seems it‚Äôs not currently possible to use Alexa to establish a scheduled brew (eg, set a 6 am brew time before going to bed the night before). Also not too impressed by Behmor support. They were my first stop and quickly punted the issue to Amazon.  I found later that it isn‚Äôt built into the skill, which i understand is a Behmor responsibility. Could have saved me time and considerable frustration if they‚Äôd owned it in the first place

title: Behmor Brewer
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2019
content: This would be great, IF all the bug's were fixed. Behmor and Alexa do not play nice together. I told Alexa to "ask Behmor to brew a quick start" and Alexa opened the Harry Potter game. Alexa thought I said Gryffindor. It showed up on the screen in a Harry Potter quiz game. It's easier to push the button on coffee brewer. It's not a good selling point for Behmor or Alexa when I'm training new employee's and simple commands don't work. No one wants life to be more complicated.

title: Software issues
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2018
content: Well, we got it to work. Took about an hour of fiddling with the software. Not user friendly. When we first turned it on it connected fine for my wife, then we could not link it to Alexa. Then it had to do a firmware update. We had to try about 10 times and then it finally started to go all on its own. The software is awful. Bare minimum and then they must have said, lets rake in the money! I can safely say its a disappointment. We were 10 seconds away from returning it and I got the Alexa part to work by un-linking it from my wife's account, making a new account in my name and then redoing the entire Alexa setup. I also think its a bit odd that its an Alexa skill to control it. I would have assumed they would have just made it a smart device like an outlet or something. Alexa can only start the coffee brew cycle, so why waste the time with all this other stuff when it gives it no extra features. I would not recommend it.

title: Does what app can't! Start a quick brew right away!

content: The nice thing about this skill is that it is a morning coffee person's dream come true... you prepare the pot and brew settings the night before and when you wake the first thing you do is ask Alexa to start brewing your coffee... hit the snooze button and 13 minutes later your coffee is ready. Now that I've written it like I need to set up a scene that does the snooze part! What is weird is that Behmor's app can't even quick start a brew afaik... you have to re-enter the settings. So short of getting up and pressing the button on the machine itself, this Alexa skill delivers the necessary functionality to make the behmor worthwhile.

title: Not in the mood to be lectured...
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 20, 2018
content: I don‚Äôt consider myself a ‚Äòfoodie‚Äô although I love cooking and reading about food. I hoped this routine might give me a little information in my flash briefing to spur my imagination, and perhaps suggest additional listening or reading. I finally disabled the skill after 2 weeks of ‚Äòlectures‚Äô running 5 minutes or more, several so condescending and self-important, I told Alexa to stop halfway thru. This skill is fine if you have longer than a few minutes, such as a relaxing weekend. If you‚Äôre listening as part of your morning routine as you rush out the door, 5 minutes of droning about why we‚Äôre idiots for not owning a digital kitchen scale is too much! I gave this skill a middle of road score as the content is often interesting; knocked off 2 stars for the length and occasional arrogance.

title: Lots of potential, but needs more features
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2016
content: One of the main reasons I got a Joule was because of the available integration with Alexa. However, while this app does what it says, it can't handle anything beyond the basis of setting a temperate on Joule, getting Joule's current temperature, and stopping Joule. I realize that this app (and device) are really new, so I'm going to just provide some suggestions for things I'd love to see for the app. Please, please keep developing this app!- Set a timer, ask timer how much time is left (would be great if it could wake Alexa up when time is up, but I realize there might be limitations from Alexa's end)- Tell me how to cook basic recipes (ideally enable me to favorite and create shortcut names for these. I.e. if I favorite "Basic Steak" in the app and rename it as "Steak", respond appropriately when I say, "Tell Joule to cook Steak". Something similar to the current phone app would be good (i.e. how thick is your steak? what doneness do you want?)- If my water is already at x degrees from being set on my phone, don't stop and reset the temperature to be the same amount, even when I ask. I've accidentally done this a few times.

title: Joule 5 stars. Alexa skills Zero
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2020
content: Pretty much worthless as is. I expected better.  Sitting five feet from my wireless router and Alexa device. Have to re-enable skill for every command.  I can turn Joule on. And it operates. 2 minutes later device not found. The Bluetooth apps works great and with WiFi can be used miles away with my phone. Alexa is worthless and the minute your hands are busy or dirty it will not work. Every other skill works fine. It is not my devices. It definitely the skills app. Needs lots of work as others have stated. Joule 5 stars, Alexa skills 0 if I could give that.

title: App has work ahead of it
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2018
content: I‚Äôm already an Amazon and Joule user with or without this app. However the tech side of me definitely yearns for more basic functionality with this app. My basic pet peeve is that I can‚Äôt check the time left on a cook. I always have my phone near me so not too big a deal but for the convenience of it all this would be extremely useful to me especially when I‚Äôm prepping sides for my meal and my hands are wet, or oily etc.As someone mentioned I‚Äôd also love to request and see the ability to set Joul on a timer with or without Alexa.That‚Äôs about it really, no issues so to speak with the app or the skill or Joule, just much needed functionality. There‚Äôs basic then there‚Äôs basic alpha stage, this is the latter unfortunately.

title: Most basic thing missing

content: Nice to be able to check and set water temp while your hands are possibly covered in meat juice so 3 out of five for that.Seems like a tremendous oversight to not include ‚ÄúAsk joule how much time is left‚Äù or have a setting to always send notifications to Echo on any event (preheat complete, cook complete, connection lost-make sure it‚Äôs still cooking, etc).....2 items that would probably be +1 star each for me

title: Needs time left feature
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2017
content: Not sure how this was left out from launch but it really needs a time left

title: Frustrating voice commands
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2019
content: I was an early adopter of Joule and have gone through every update they have offered for the app to work with Alexa. The early version seemed to work better but it seems with each update it gets worse. I'll say, "Alexa, ask Joule to cook salmon.", and the response is usually "I didn't understand that". Even if you say, "Alexa, open Joule" first, it still doesn't understand the command to cook salmon. It rarely understands the command, "Alexa, ask Joule to set the temperature to 130 degrees".  It's extremely frustrating and this voice control part of the app needs serious work.When controlling with your smartphone, it seems to work very well, however, although the templates for very common dishes are nonexistent. It's usually just better to set the temp and time manually via the smartphone.Chef steps, please work on the voice command section of this app!

title: Very Limited
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2020
content: The Joule is fantastic; however, the Alexa Skill is very limited...with only a little attention by programmers, it is capable of doing so much more. title: Can't turn off. Voice commands are 10%-25% effective
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 1, 2018
content: First off, Alexa only recognises "jewel" about a third of the time. "Julie" works more often,  but I find "sous vide" is the most reliable name  to use when accessing Joule. When I use that name, at least I can tell that Alexa is forwarding the text request to the "Joule" skill more than 90% of the time.That said, I can't figure out how to turn the device off. { tell | ask } "sous vide" to { stop | turn off | power off } do not work. Sometimes I get the status report. Other times I get "I can't tell what you want".Marginally functional.But when it works, voice control is still easier than the Chef steps app.

title: Use "Alexa, Open Joule" to connect
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2017
content: I can confirm Joule works with Dash Wand, which I guess might be handy if I've already got the Wand nearby and am busy doing several things in the kitchen.What's not clear in the Alexa app skills page is that every time you start a Joule session, you need to state, "Alexa, open Joule" ("Alexa" not needed with Dash Wand) in order to connect Joule to Alexa. Alexa will confirm the connection. That's where it goes a bit soft. Any logical commands or questions such as, "Ask Joule to set to 135¬∞" or, "Ask Joule what the current status is," are met with, "I know how to cook different types of steak, chicken and pork. What would you like to cook?"Hopefully it evolves to be able to answer more naturally.

title: can't do more than set temperature
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020
content: try as i might, i can't get Alexa to stop joule. I've opened joule and asked Alexa to stop joule, I've asked Alexa to stop joule by name.  Each time Alexa claims to not know joule although it did start joule. I've tried "stop", "quit", nothing seems to work except grabbing my cellphone and going to the app.

date: Reviewed in the United States on May 11, 2018

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
content: its swell, but would be far superior if it could tell you more than the current temperature.

title: So Far So Good!
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2018
content: My first experience using Joule with Alexa was very pleasant. I told her to ‚Äútell Joule to cook a steak‚Äù. Alexa recommended the temperature for Medium-Rare which I accepted, she asked me if the meat was fresh or frozen (frozen) and she asked how thick (1‚Äù). She then told me to put the steak in for 1 hour and 30 minutes when the water was heated. The alarm sounded when the preheat was complete on both my phone and Alexa (nice touch). The only thing Alexa couldn‚Äôt do was to tell Joule to set the timer for the suggested time.  It may have been the syntax I used or maybe she can‚Äôt tell Joule to do that. At least Alexa can set my timer.Overall I‚Äôm happy with this skill. I may come back and give it 5 Stars once I‚Äôve been successful cooking a few more things.

title: Not very useful
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2018
content: It's nice that you can kick off the Joule with it, but why is the status check so useless? The main thing we want from it is the ability to check how much time is left - why hasn't that feature been enabled?

date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2018

title: Timer
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2017
content: It would be so nice to be able to ask how much longer is on Joule's timer. That's really the only reason I don't use this skill exclusively to control my Joule.

title: Abysmal
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2018
content: This app should never have seen light of day.  It doesn't support basic functionality like quitting.  Be prepared to listen to endless loops of "I couldn't find anything, what would you like to cook" with no reasonable solution (doesn't recognize cancel, quit, silence... end up having to unplug).  It doesn't support basic items (e.g. hamburger).  It can't tell you how long is left and provides no indication when a cook is complete.This app seems like it was developed by someone who has never used an echo.

title: most reviews here are, er, how should i say?
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2022
content: This is a good app if you don't want to use your phone to control Joule.  People giving 1 star because it doesn't give "remaining time" don't understand sous vide.  You can leave a steak in sous vide for hours before searing, for example.  There's no such thing as remainig time. The Joule app doesn't have "remaining time" either.

title: I was skeptical...
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2016
content: Hands-free cooking with Joule makes total sense. I was skeptical about the value of voice control. But if you have multiple things going on in the kitchen,  voice control is the way to go. I have a big open kitchen. The Joule has no display. It doesn't need one if you have voice control, a phone and notifications on your Apple Watch. When I have a bigger tub with ribs or tri-tip going, that Joule sits in my pantry and is out of sight. I still can control it as it would be right there on the counter. Awesome!Maybe all of this is not for everyone at this point, but works perfectly well for me.

title: I love my Joule Hardware but this skill is woefully inadequate
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2018
content: I love my Joule Hardware but this skill is woefully inadequate. Seriously, you can't even tell me how much time is left? What's even the point?

title: Decent
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2018
content: Asking for the status tells you current temp vs target temp. It'd be nice if it also told you how much time remained. Or if you could ask, "How much time is left?", that'd be nice too. Thanks

title: Best prosumer sous vide device on the market, hands down.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2016
content: Joule is my second sous vide and the one I find myself reaching for 90% of the time. It works great with my Amazon Echo (rapidly becoming another useful kitchen appliance) and I no longer bother with the app unless I want to prepare something I've not done before.  The awesome people at Chefsteps have released an innovative, useful, high quality product--amazing since this is their first attempt at a consumer device. The compact design is elegant, has a powerful heating element, is easy to maintain and the magnet on the bottom is genius.  If you are in the market for a prosumer duty sous vide and don't want to kick it up to a $500 device, this one completely beats out the Anova, the Sous Vide Supreme and the other ones on the market.

title: Honor, Glory and Acclaim to ChefSteps!
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2016
content: This is a shout out to ChefSteps:  "ALRIGHT! You guys got it!"I started w/a homemade set up, got a Poly Science. Sold it for Anova and finally here with Joule.  After one day with this unit I knew I was at the end of my sous vide journey. Today I got my second Jouole so the two Anova units will be sold. I actually think the Joule is on par with the Poly Science units which I still admire. What about Anova? If I could trade one for a Joule I would in a heart beat. How about it? Do you need a first or second generation Anova for the ChefSteps Sous Vide Museum? Joule rules!Brian Olsenp.s. got one Joule doing some short ribs from SAARS and the other doing three pot roasts from Winco. Hey, a guys gotta eat!

title: Don't use this for cooking time
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2018
content: I ostensibly set the timer for Joule using Alexa, but when I asked Alexa for status, it gave me only temperature and no timing info; even worse,  the Alexa App on my phone didn't have the timer set via Alexa--so I had to guess the timing.  Silly on my part to trust this technology!Update: Alexa actually did alert me when the time was up.  So the concerns are: 1) how to ask Alexa how much time is remaining, and 2) why the Joule App doesn't know about the time set by Alexa.

title: Alexa is an added bonus to a great product!
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 4, 2016
content: I have been waiting for the joule about 10 months and I am not disappointed in the product at all.  The size and function is perfect and I have not experienced any issues.  I am blown away with how powerful and quickly it heats to temperature.  (much faster than my Anova)  The magnetic bottom is wonderful as well and less annoying than using a clamp to secure the device to a pot.  Connecting it with my Echo Dot has been a huge positive as well and nothing is better than using voice control to change temperature or to turn off.  The only criticism I would have is that there doesn't seem to be control to set the cook time by voice.  If Joule and Alexa allow you to set the timer there is less than adequate instructions on either site.  Overall I am super happy I bought Joule and it certainly is enhanced with a $50 added Dot.

title: Phone free cooking!
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2017

title: I loved the skill when I first started using it
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2017
content: I am visually impaired so my friend is writing this for me. I loved the skill when I first started using it, It gave me a great sense of freedom with my cooking. I have always enjoyed cooking but after the loss of my eyesight I had become very restricted in what I could cook. The only way I could try new things was to burden other people to find and read a recipe for me. The Allrecipes skill removed that need and gave me the ability to explore and cook on my own once again, Now that the skill only reads the first two steps and then tells me to go to the alexa app I am back where I was before. I can not understand why this skill was changed since it was so helpful to the visually impaired.¬†Please explain why you would modify a skill without considering the negative impact it would have on the visually impaired community.

title: NEED to change back to step by step instructions.
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 9, 2017
content: I work with the blind and visually impaired and this skill WAS amazing to help people cook without having to look at a recipe. You were able get a step verbally and then after doing the task, ask for the next one. They have changed this skill and now it gives you the first step and then tells you to go look at the Alexa skill. I was teaching my clients about this skill and it was extremely helpful. Now it is not helpful at all. Please change this Skill to have step by step instructions again.

title: Feedback for the Next AR Skill Update: Echo Show
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2018
content: This skill has so much potential!! I hope this feedback is considered in the next iteration/update. I bought an Echo Show (voice + screen) specifically because I use a lot of recipes in the kitchen and I wanted a device that would pull up the recipe and the screen wouldn't time out, one that I didn't need to touch with my messy cooking fingers (i.e. my phone). And when I found out Allrecipes had a skill, i was stoked! I love All Recipes for it's curated community ratings and feedback on recipe improvements.This weekend, I made three AR meals with my Echo Show and ran into a few key problems that I think are easy fixes:- The step-by-step feature told me what to do, but didn't always include the correct ingredients on the screen, which made me have to go back to the beginning to confirm the correct measurements for specific ingredients not listed (this could be a larger fix - recipe translation from text to device).- In leu of the step-by-step being 100% accurate, it would have been a smoother experience to just have the full recipe and instructions pulled up on the Echo Show screen and I could tell Alexa to scroll down when i needed to. But every time I attempted to have the full recipe up on the screen, the skill timed out when I went to add an ingredient in the pot. Every time, I was sent to the Echo home screen and had to re-launch the skill.- I also don't need Alexa to keep asking me 'do you need more time on this step?'. Making a roux takes more than 2 minutes, I'll tell Alexa when I am ready for the next step.Overall, the timing-out is the most disappointing aspect of this skill for the Echo Show. I double and triple check recipes, it takes me longer to complete them (especially baking recipes where measurements matter), it would be nice if the script for this skill was more intuitive to the cooking experience. It probably took me an extra hour to get through all the recipes because i had to navigate the the shortcomings of this skill.Prior to using the skill, I was raving to people about how my cooking experience with digital recipes was going to be elevated in the kitchen, and how AR was going to be my digital cookbook. I had people considering buying a Show for that reason. I believe the future of voice in the kitchen includes screen support, people want to see recipes when they cook. And millenials are used to and comfortable with screens. If you make any tweaks to this app, I encourage them to be for screen-enabled devices. More people will invest, if the experience is a positive one. Thanks for your consideration.

What would you like to search for?"Recipe using quinoa"Sorry, I didn't get that. What would you like to search for?"Never mind"Sorry, I didn't get that. What would you like to search for?"Exit"Sorry, I didn't get that. What would you like to search for?"Stop"Sorry, I didn't get that. What would you like to search for?"Nothing!"Sorry, I didn't get that. What would you like to search for?"Quiet"Sorry, I didn't get that. What would you like to search for?"....."What would you like to search for?"............."What would you like to search for?"Shut up!"Sorry, I didn't get that. What would you like to search for?"Exit"Sorry, I didn't get that. What would you like to search for?"#$#$$#_###+-!!!!"Sorry, I didn't get that. What would you like to search for?"

title: Great Skill with Exceptions
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2019
content: I love using Allrecipes so enabling this skill was an easy choice for me. That said, I have 2 little problems with this skill.1st: Linking your Allrecipes account requires a username and password. If you've created an account using Facebook info as your login, it won't work.  If you've created an account using Google as your login, you won't even see an option to use it.  I had to go to the Allrecipes website, ask to be e-mailed a link to reset my password, and only then was I able to link the skill.2nd: When a recipe comes up on screen, it only shows for about 30 seconds before going back to the home screen. I typically have to search a recipe 3 or 4 times to make sure I've covered all of the steps.This is still a great skill to use, even with its flaws.  If a fix for these problems could be made, I would give this skill 5 stars.

If you take too much time completing a step, it will ask repeatedly if you‚Äôre ready to continue, which is irritating. There is no ability to ask for clarification on a step, ie; if you‚Äôve forgotten the measurement of one ingredient in a step, you can‚Äôt ask ‚Äúhow much sugar‚Äù, and instead must have the entire step repeated. It‚Äôs easier to just pull the recipe up on a screen. Perhaps this skill is better suited for the Echo Show.

title: Useless for my recipe collection
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2021
content: Do developers even test these thigs before release?? I went through and added over 22 of my personal recipes and this will only display the first 10. It won't find anything not in that first 10. Just trying to get the skill to start was an exercise in frustration trying to figure out the correct phrase. For example, I would say "Alexa, launch My Cookbook" on my echo show and it would launch Facebook. I finally found that I would have to say "Alexa, show my recipes with my cookbook" and it would launch but still only show 10 recipes. It may be able to find other recipes but I am not going to spend hours figuring out the correct phrase. Some testing and some actual documentation on how to use it would be a refreshing change from most of these skill developers. Will disable this skill and continue my search for one that actually works.

date: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2018
content: I absolutely love my FlameBoss 300!!!  The app has a great interface and one can easily adjust the pit temp. They are always willing to help when you have a question. If you are in the market for this type of machinery get yourself a FlameBoss unit you will not regret it!  With the new 500 unit on the way I can't wait to see what I can make on my Kamado grills! Thank you FlameBoss for a great product, you have a customer for life!

title: At last, my dream made reality
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2018
content: Finally, a skill that matches my dream, to be with me in the kitchen when my hands are too dirty to poke around a tablet even if in a waterproof case or my phone whose screen is too small for greasy hands.The skill is very fluid in handling tons of scenarios from the reverse backup step to the pause to the repeat to the inevitable long lags of silence while I go away to hunt for items or the general chaos of the frustrated moments that don't throw the recipe flow off-course. The calm reliable handling of steps helps me to cook better so thanks to all designers for thinking everything through and through.

title: The comfort of ketchup!
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2017
content: Sometimes the simplest things make all the difference.  It was just one of those days where nothing seemed to go right, my wife was sick and the kids were crazier than normal. I was trying to manage the house, my job, sick wife and give the kids what they needed. Things seemed to be under control until about 3pm. I'm not sure if it was PBS's afternoon shows or that fact i served marshmellows and squeeze cheese for lunch but by 3:15 my house looked like a reenactment of Lord of the Flies.I had to calm them down. I had to figure something out. I was going to loose my mind. What can i give them? What can i make? WHAT IS IN THE PANTRY?  Thankfully i loaded the ketchup dip skill for my Alexa. I was easily guided through a recipe that made me look like Gordon Ramsey (with no cursing) to my kids. I gently placed the bowl and added a bag of chips. The silence was heaven. If only i had tried it earlier. Thank you ketchupdip.com

title: It works when set up right
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2016
content: I read every review before setting this up, then tried to avoid the issues that were mentioned. I went to the Our Groceries website and deleted the default Shopping List.  Then I created specific lists like Groceries and Target. I have one called Sally, for Sally Beauty Supply. After creating an account and password on that website, I was ready to link Alexa. She worked like a charm! "Alexa, ask Our Groceries to add gel to Sally."... "Added gel to Sally." (love her) I checked my phone app and there it was, like magic. "Alexa, ask Our Groceries to add toilet paper to Target."...." Adding toilet paper to Target." She has performed just as well ever since.

title: I like it and use it
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2016
content: Jeff MillsIf you were able to add more than 1 item at a time you would really have a very useful skill!  Having to ask to open the skill for each item is crazy, my wife looks at me then starts laffing, other friends usually jump in too. Help me out with this Please üòè

title: A bit tedious- needs improvement
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2017
content: Very convenient to be able to add items through Alexa, but it should ask if you want to add another item instead of having to open the skill every time - makes adding things very tedious. Would give 5 stars if this was implemented.

title: This fit our needs better than My Chef!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2016
content: We recently bought 3 amazon dots, one in the living room, bedroom and kitchen.  I read about both this skill and the my chef skill and started with what I though would be better was My Chef.  I have prime and have my husband under my prime account, so essentially we have 2 amazon accounts.  We would have to ask Alexa what account is this and since my husband does most of the grocery shopping, would have to first change to his account so the items would be put into My Chef shopping list.  Well sometimes he forgot and the items he said would go into my AMAZON list.  Then if the item was more than one word it would list it as separate item, like "garlic sausage" it would put on the list garlic and then another item sausage.  So it wasn't working out for us.  Then I installed OurGroceries, LOVE IT!!  You can "link" accounts so that no matter what amazon account you are on, when you say "Alexa, ask our groceries to add garlic sausage to shopping list" it adds it as ONE item to the list and it adds it automatically to BOTH our lists and is always syncing with each other.  The best thing, when he goes shopping and crosses items off the list, since the list is synced on our phones, it takes them off the list on my phone app as well!!  Have had NO problems with it so far and it was exactly what we were looking for!!  No it doesn't have the neat pantry options or can see what is expired like My Chef, but OurGroceries has the features we want and use more than My Chef.

title: Pity Amazon Won‚Äôt Let Customers Choose Their Own Default Shopping List
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2019
content: I‚Äôm offering this four stars for two reasons I can‚Äôt add more than one item at a time into the list. If you are drawing up a large shopping list it becomes tiring to have to say for each item ‚ÄòAlexa ask Our Groceries to put PRODUCT in shopping list.‚Äô The developers really need to look at this. That said if you have a large enough Master List then doing it on your phone, tablet etc., should be no hassle just leaving the odd product been added in via Alexa itself.My second, and its Amazon‚Äôs fault not Our Groceries, is that I can‚Äôt make it my default list as I‚Äôm sure many users would like to do. While it‚Äôs not Our Groceries fault it is a hassle which I‚Äôm sure readers will agree withOn a more positive note I found a major shopping list online broken down into categories e.g. Fruit & Veg and Baking produce and spent an evening filling out my Masterlist with this detail.  All the hard word is done so it will just require a few tweaks here and there and I should have all I needLike many others I think the ad free version is to expensive.  I‚Äôd willingly pay ¬£2, but that would be about it, especially if I can‚Äôt make it my default Shopping ListI also enjoy the ability to have more than one shopping list. At the moment I have two lists. One for the weekly shop and a second for a monthly type shop where I‚Äôll have bulky and heavy goods as well as my normal shop delivered to my door

title: Another wah
date: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2019
content: If you don't want to have to say "Our Groceries" every time, just setup a shopping list on Alexa and then you can just say "Add _______ to my shopping list". Whenever you get to the store, just open up the shopping list in the Alexa app. You can also add multiple items at the same time.

title: Why can't we add several items to our list
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2019
content: When we ask Alexa to go to our groceries and add item to shopping list it only allows for one item then you have to repeat yourself all over again ALEXA OUR GROCERIES then she responds with ( welcome to our groceries you can say add milk to shopping list ) and we have to wait and  listen to this over and over again just to add an item to the list, we sound ridiculous  asking over and over and listening to the same welcome over and over just to put another item on our list. Please fix this.

title: Does exactly what it should and what I needed
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2017
content: Ever since I started keeping my grocery list on my phone I've longed for a way to quickly add items to the list by talking to my phone. This Alexa skill lets me do exactly that at exactly the time I need it: when I'm in the middle of prepping a meal. Now, with my Dot near the kitchen, when I'm making breakfast and am close to using up all our eggs, I simply say: "Alexa, ask OurGroceries to add eggs," and eggs automatically shows up on my default OurGroceries list. If it's something we get from another store (for which I've set up a list), I just as the name of the store. So, if we're running low in paper towels, "Alexa, ask OurGroceries to add paper towels to Costco" does exactly what I've asked and paper towels is added to my Costco list in OurGroceries. And the ability to do this is still so new (we've had the Dot for only a couple of weeks) that every time I do it, and Alexa responds "Eggs have been added to Smith's" I can't help but think, "Sweet!"

title: Highly recommend
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2018
content: I wish I could say, "Alexa, add milk to my groceries list" instead of saying, "Alexa, ask our groceries....". So it would be nice to be able to set this as default grocery list but whatever. It's extremely useful and works flawlessly.

date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2019
content: Just got this app.  Need ability to add multiple items to list easily through Alexa.  For example Alexa add the following items to Our Groceries shopping list Tea next paper towels next with the word next signaling a new item in the list.  Also it would be nice to select Our Groceries as the default shopping list app so that you would only need to say Alexa add to shopping list or if a different named list like Target Alexa add to Target shopping list item(s) versus having to say Our Groceries every time.  Would need the ability to return to Alexa shopping list as default if desired as well. If these features are added my rating will change.

title: Fantastic App

title: Great App But Needs Tweaking
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2018
content: Love the Our Groceries App but the skill of Alexa needs some tweaking. You have to be very specific in how you add to the Our Groceries app. You need to specifically say "ask" or "tell" Our Groceries to add the item. Otherwise Alexa will respond that it cannot find "Our Groceries" and wants to know whether she needs to add a list. Everything that I have actually was lucky enough to have it add directly to Our Groceries is found at the bottom uncategorized.

title: Could use a few tweaks but great free app and skill for Alexa.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2017
content: We used OurGroceries before we got our Alexa devices.  The skill works great.  I don't know why people are having problems linking it.  I would suggest for those people that they  make sure that they create a list in the Ourgroceries app on their phone and then set their grocery list as the default.  Then it should be as simple as saying "Alexa, tell Our Groceries to add eggs".  If that doesn't put eggs on your default grocery list then disable and re-enable the skill in the alexa app or on the alexa.amazon.com website.  Ours lost the sync once and this brought it back.I agree that it would be nice to be able to disable the amazon grocery list so that you could leave out the "Tell our groceries" part and just say "Alexa, add eggs to Publix"

title: Excellent add on if you already use for lists (especially shared)
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2017
content: If you use our groceries and already have it setup with list sharing this works great.  Do that first and then add to alexa. There's a few things the app itself is lacking, but as an add on for it I love it.Some useful commands:Alexa, ask OurGroceries to add <item> to <list name>Alexa, ask OurGroceries to remove <item> from <list name>Alexa, ask OurGroceries what's on the <list name>Alexa, ask OurGroceries if I have <item> on a listFeature request:ability to move items between lists - move <item> from <current list> to <new list>

Also, Alexa should ask you if you'd like to add something else no matter where what list  you put your item on instead of having to say "Alexa" for every single item. Since the OurGroceries is shared with the Alexa app it should automatically sync every time you add an item to Alexa's shopping list so you wouldn't have to say "Alexa, open OurGroceries".  If that would change that would be great and I would give this a 5 star.

title: Great App but

title: Needs better logic

content: You have open the skill every time you want to add a single item. Other skills loop accordingly and ask you if you want to do anything else after you've added an item. This should be able to do the same.I

title: Has Possibility
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2017
content: Has nice features and therefore possibilities.  Instructions with pairing other devices could be a bit clearer or easier to find, but that's a detail perhaps.Unlike the default Shopping List provided by Alexa, this allows you to create unlimited types of shopping lists (grocery, hardware, clothing, pets, etc) and within those lists allows you to segment by type of product; e.g. with grocery you can segregate by frozen food, vegetables, dairy, etc.  And once you label (or change it) a product as say dairy, it will be categorized as dairy in any list you've created.  Categorizing things in lists can be extremely helpful as usually when grocery shopping foods, household goods, etc are all in the same categorical area.This product has other features such as barcode by a particuar product that I'm not sure of the value of right now.This product has nice possibiliities, it will be interesting to see how user friendly it is in real life application.

title: Love, love this skill!
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2017
content: This is one of the first skills I enabled. I constantly use it. When in the kitchen and notice I'm running low on an item, when looking through flyers, when someone suggests something to try and even when my hubby needs me to pick up an item at the store. Really, super helpful! Please, do not say "shopping list". Alexa will add to Echo/dot shopping list, not to OurGroceries skill. Thanks HeadCode!

title: The BEST out there by far!
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2016
content: I tried darn near every list app there and they all fell way short until I found Our Groceries. First, it works across all my platforms, Android phone, 2 generations of Kindle/Fire, and on my PC in a web browser. Second, I can create all the different lists I want and name them as I want. Next, I can pick different sort orders for the things that are on the "Buy" list and the things I have "Crossed-off" my list. The Crossed-off list I keep in alphabetic order to make it easy to find things. For all my actual grocery items I have assigned the aisle in the store as the category. So i sort the Buy list, by category and all my list is in the order I find them in the store. I check-off (long press) each item as I grab it. They item goes to the Crossed-off list for next time and my Buy List scrolls up. Perfect and simple!When this became a skill for my Echo I was thrilled, but there were a few problems at first. First problem, my echo was not always understanding "ask Our Groceries...". I looked at the Alexa app when it failed and found it was interpreting "our" as "are". So now I just say "ask R Groceries..." and it works great. (It must be my mid-west accent...)Second, when I would ask it to add something to one of my lists that was already on my Crossed-off list, it would create a new item (uncategorized). I contacted Our Groceries support and it turned out to be a issue that it was not recognizing capitals and lower-case as the same. They fixed it and I am a happy camper.While I am in the kitchen cooking and I discover I am running low or out of an item, I simply call out "Echo, ask R Groceries to add butter to the Grocery List". So nice not having to remember to put it on the list later or having to wipe off my hand to do it immediately.I have lots of list that aren't even related to shopping. For example, my Library list has 2 items - "Pick up materials" and "Return materials". When I get an email notice from the library I have something to pick up, I call out, "Echo, ask R Groceries to add Pick Up Materials to the Library List". Then when I look over Our Groceries' list of Lists (a daily habit now), I see the count is 1 and I am reminded I need to go to the library. I can do the same for my RedBox videos too. Very handy!I don't know why so many people gave reviews saying it didn't work for them, but I suspect the problem was not with the skill itself.

title: A perfect match!
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2016
content: Works great. I believe that most people are having issues with pairing Alex with OurGroceries.  For me it was very easy once the skill was enabled, it asked for the my OurGroceries account info and that was that.  Best part is that I have multiple lists based on Ralphs, Whole Foods, etc..  You just say "Alexa, ask OurGroceries to add organic strawberries to Whole Foods" and she does it perfectly.  I do not maintain my lists from Alexa, only add and for this it is 5 stars!  It would be great to know what additional commands that OurGroceries supports with Alexa, but that is a common complaint I have with all of Alexa skills, such as Insteon and so on.

title: Needs improvement
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2017
content: It allows you to set a list as a default, but for some reason it doesn't then add things to that list, so you still have to tell it what list to add to.It can be tedious to constantly say "tell our groceries to add X to my Y list.

title: Love the app, but needs tighter integration with Alexa
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2019
content: This app would be perfect if it directly integrated with the built-in Alexa shopping list!We can't use this because if you forget to say "ask our groceries", it adds to the built in Alexa list.  managing 2 shopping lists is a pain...  If the Alexa list and Our Groceries list would sync automatically, would be so much better...

title: Not Bad But Could be Better
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2017
content: Really love the OurGroceries app on our phones to coordinate lists between my wife and I. I had no problems linking to Alexa as some have described. I do find the Alexa skill problematic as it is difficult to delineate between Our Groceries lists and the native Alexa shopping list. It would be great if you could disable the native Alexa list, but alas no. I also agree that it could do much better with multiple items.

title: This would be a10 star app if I could just ...
date: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2018
content: This would be a10 star app if I could just say "add (item) to (specific list) without first opening "Our Grocery" Is there some way to make this action a default of some kind?

title: Speak Alexa's language properly
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2017
content: Need to know how to set this up properly.  Name your shopping lists e.g. Costco, Store, etc. Then just say "Alexa, ask our groceries to add paper towels to Costco" or "Alexa, ask our groceries to add eggs to Store"Works great, and when you share the app that's when it's really helpful.  I'll admit it's not super intuitive but once you start using it, it becomes easier.

title: Hears random words
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2017
content: It works alright with the our groceries app. But it often hears words out letters that weren't said. Example. If I say"add eggs to shopping list" it will add "eggs hvtv3bp" to my shopping list. It once added "razor blades Deacon plain" instead of razor blades. Otherwise it's only ok. The weird words don't happen every time and are different each time it does happen.  I guess that makes it kinda entertaining as long I can guess what I'm supposed to pick up from the store.

title: Alexa integration is terrible
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2019
content: Only 1 in 10 items actually makes it on the OurGroceries list from Alexa.  All other items are placed on the built-in Alexa shopping list.  The phrasing needs to be perfect and is too verbose. "Alexa, ask our groceries .......(wait a few moments for alexa to respond)... add apples to shopping list".

title: Glad to have it!
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2016
content: This is probably my most-used Skill, although there is room for improvement. In an ideal world, we would be able to make OurGroceries the default shopping lists of the Echo, so we wouldn't need to use the slightly awkward "Alexa, ask OurGroceries..." line. But this is a current Echo shortcoming & has nothing to do with the Skill or the App Developer.You will, however, find that in most cases when you ask Alexa to add an item to a list, this will result in a new item being created & added, instead of calling up an existing item you've already created in the app. I suspect this could be due to the fact that in the OurGroceries app, new items default to capitalization (like "Eggs") but the skill adds the item to a list without capitalization ("eggs"). It's not too difficult to delete duplicates or make corrections, but it would be nice to not have to fix things, either.But overall it works well and has helped me several times when I am in the kitchen with my Echo Dot & my phone isn't available. It's great to have this option for what was already a really useful app for my family.

title: Invocation issues - I think I know what might be giving a lot of you trouble (see bottom)
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2017
content: First... "Alexa tell our  groceries to add milk to the shopping list" is quite a mouthful.I found You could set the default "ourgroceries" list.  Do this:  "Alexa, tell our groceries to add milk."  Alexa will come back and ask "what list?"  Answer, then THAT will be your default list. Luckily the first one I used was the list I wanted to be default.. 'cause I don't know how to change it.Now, it is a bit shorter without the end, but still .. "tell our groceries," while not a tongue twister, is quite a lot, especially if you want to add a few items.Try this for example:" Alexa tell our groceries to add milk"" Alexa tell our  groceries to add eggs"" Alexa tell our  groceries to add cheese"Is there a way to change the invocation phrase????  "our groceries" is 12 syllables in that list above!  Add milk, eggs and cheese is only 6?!  That's a lot of overheadAS FOR THE INVOCATION PROBLEM:Alexa, tell our groceries add milkAlexa, tell our groceries _to_ add milk."TO" Gets me our groceries, without it get me the Alexa list.  THIS FACT ALONE will probably stop me from using this. That's a bit ridiculous.. I know we will wind up with half our stuff in the wrong place.  I realize this is probably an Alexa issue not "OurGroceries," but if there isn't a way to make this less likely, this skill will likely be deleted.

title: Great for adding items.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2017
content: Works well. As others said use the correct word order. For example, to add strawberries to my Costco category I would say: ‚ÄúAlexa, add strawberries to Costco in OurGroceries‚Äù. If Echo responds ‚ÄúAdded strawberries to Costco‚Äù then it did what I wanted. If the Echo says ‚ÄúAdded strawberries to your shopping list‚Äù then it was added to the Alexa Shopping & To-do List. You can also ask Alexa to read back the categories you created in OurGroceries.

title: 5 star with a tweak
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2018
content: App works great and I actually really like it. My issue is having to tell Alexa to ask ourgroceries to add an item is a little inconvenient.  Would be better if you could just tell her to add to shopping list.....minus the having to refer to ourgroceries.

title: Integrates Well!
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2018
content: This skill works great with Alexa.  I like that anyone in the family can add to our lists without them having to have the app installed on their own phones.

title: Great list keeping app, and Alexa app functionality is full featured
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2018
content: I‚Äôve been using OurGroceries for a long time now.  The cross platform capabilities are great. If Amazon allowed me to change the default shopping list Alexa functionality - this would be it.

title: Nice app
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2018
content: It would be even better if it let you add multiple items

title: Learn correct phrase to avoid lead in greeting
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2017
content: Even my wife, the technology resistant person she is, enjoys this app. To avoid hearing the lead in phrase use this exact message [think password]:  Alexa, Ask Our Groceries to add "x" to the main list. It works!  Alexa then responds added "x" to main list."x" =  the item you want to add.

title: Decent App ALEXA Makes it VERY ANNOYING
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2018
content: I am writing this review under duress.  Each time I use the app, Alexa gives a very long winded, very annoying, borderline harassing speech to write a review.  So under duress I am writing this...Except for ALEXA, the app is a decent app to use especially since you can sync the lists with other devices and share the lists with other people.  I have been using the app for several years now...Alexa makes it annoying to use.

title: Fantastic - Works perfect.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2017
content: Wish people would stop blaming their own incompetence on the app. If you don't say the right thing, it won't do the right thing. It's a machine. You must say "Alexa, TELL OUR GROCERIES" or Alexa will use her own list. You must follow that up with "add <product> to <list name>". If your list is called "shopping list" and you say "grocery list" it won't work!! You can have many lists. If you want salt and your list is called "walmart" you say: "Alexa, tell our groceries to add salt to walmart." Works 100% of the time for me.

title: Great app. Feature request!
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2018
content: Love the app, but wish it had the ability to add multiple items in one go instead of one at a time. Being able to say, ‚ÄúTell Our Groceries to add butter and milk and eggs and trash bags and chicken‚Äù would be awesome!

title: Best Grocery App available
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2018
content: I have been using Our Groceries for years. The fact that I could customize as many lists as I wanted made it my first choice. Then we could link it through your our family so that I could simply text a teenager and say, ‚ÄúPop over to ____ and buy everything on the list, please.‚Äù  Then we were given an Echo and I discovered that I can sort through the pantry and cupboards, verbally adding items to each lust just by using my voice. Now it‚Äôs on my Apple Watch ‚Äî this app is hands down my most frequently used!

title: Amazing when it works
date: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2019
content: pretty reliable most of the time, though lately I've been having problems with lists that are abbreviations (such as the wholesaler bj's).  the app has started adding junk to the end of the command, ruining the  result.  I also wish you could add quantities for items (you can in the app) with voice.holding off on purchasing the pro version of the app until such time it's more consistent, but we're overall relatively happy with it.

title: Fantastic skill with one area of improvement
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 22, 2020
content: This application answered my need for a grocery list program that I can use on Alexa, iPhone, and web browser. It also is nice because my husband and I can see and add to the same list.I love being able to tell Alexa to ask our groceries to add an item to our list. The reason I gave four stars instead of five is because you have to invoke Alexa for every single item. I would like to rattle off a list of items instead of one at a time.

title: Ignores my master list
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2017
content: This skill ignores my master list and makes a new item every time, so I end up with duplicate items every time I add one.  It would be a lot more useful if it checked the master list for the items you're adding before creating a new one.

title: Works Great
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2018
content: Using OurGroceries we add things to our shopping list using my iPad, my wife‚Äôs phone and, most often, Alexa.  When we go to the store we use the app on my Android phone as we shop.  Because of the categories, our list shows up pretty much in the same order as the aisles in the store.  I paid for the app on my Android, but I use the free ad-supported version on my iPad.  I used to use Google Keep for my lists, but when Goggle switched to the new Google Assistant List mess, I looked around and found OurGroceries. It really works well with Alexa.  Recommended.

title: Needs a few tweaks
date: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2018
content: A very good skill that has been incredibly helpful, and is probably the thing we use Alexa for most often. It can sometimes get confused when trying to add items to a list other than the default list.My main complaint is when adding an item that is already on the list, it just increases the quantity of that item instead of warning you the item is already listed, and asking you to confirm that you‚Äôd still like to add it. Asking Alexa to remove the duplicate item does not reduce the quantity, and instead removes the item completely. This is frustrating.

title: Works great for lists. Would love a little more account sync.
date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2016
content: Would love if I could associate my SAFEWAY/WALMART/ALBERTSONS whatever store account to the OurGroceries account so that when I'm at the physical store it's showing me my list with that app. (Synced) verses holding onto two lists, one from Alexa with what I wanted while at home and one that includes my coupons/savings and things within the store.If you own any Alexa-enabled device, you can ask it to add items to your OurGroceries shopping lists using your voice. To make this possible, follow these steps:***You‚Äôll need your OurGroceries master email address and password. If you don‚Äôt have a password, create one first. [...] ***Launch the Alexa app on your mobile phone, open the menu on the left, tap ‚ÄúSkills‚Äù, then search for ‚ÄúOurGroceries‚Äù. Tap the ‚ÄúEnable‚Äù button to enable the skill.The Alexa app will ask for your OurGroceries master email address and password. This information will go straight to OurGroceries. Alexa will not know your password, and your information will be transmitted securely to us. Enter the information from step 1 and tap ‚ÄúSign In‚Äù.Be sure that the OurGroceries skill is properly installed in your Alexa account. Use the Alexa app on your phone to check your list of installed skills. (Tap ‚ÄúSkills‚Äù in the menu on the left, then select ‚ÄúYour Skills‚Äù in the ‚ÄúRefine‚Äù menu.)If you have multiple profiles on your Alexa device, be sure that the active profile is the one you installed the skill on. It‚Äôs easiest to install the OurGroceries skill on all your profiles.*****Be sure to include the ‚Äúask OurGroceries‚Äù phrase when speaking, or Alexa will think that you‚Äôre adding an item to its built-in shopping list.*****

title: Love that services I currently use are available with Alexa

title: Very handy

title: Great, easy to use

It would also be super cool if, when I ask Alexa to add an item that's already on my list, it would say so and ask if I wanted to add another before actually adding it.Thanks for making this!

content: So far so good.  No trouble at all getting Alexa to recognize this skill.  You do have to follow the instructions to get it to pair:  https://www.ourgroceries.com/faq#amazon_echo. title: Works surprisingly well.
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2021
content: Aside from the awkwardness of Amazon not allowing direct support of a third party shopping list, so I have to ask Alexa to ask OurGroceries, the options are clear and relatively instinctive. It's easy to add or delete items from any list. You can also add multiple items.I'm not good at remembering commands, so when I wanted to add multiple items to a list, I told Alexa to tell OurGroceries to add multiple items. I half expected to see "multiple items" appear as an item on my list, but OurGroceries surprised me and did exactly what I wanted.Far too many Alexa commands for third party use are counterintuitive, and this is the first time I've seen a third party add on get it completely right.I contacted Amazon separately to suggest that they allow third party shopping list support integrally, so I can simply say "add [item] to shopping list" and Amazon said that it's a great suggestion. So it wouldn't hurt if others ask for the same thing, to show that demand is there.

title: Convenient

title: Most useful skill on my Echo
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2018
content: If you're a user of the Our Groceries app, this skill is a must-have. Being able to add to a list the second you notice you need something, no phone required, is really handy. Highly recommended.

title: Use this app constantly.
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2016
content: While cooking it's easy to update your shopping list without having to stop, find your list, write an item down, then remember what you were doing.  Then you don't forget your list when you go to the store - you can always have it with you on your phone.

title: Intermittent Connection
date: Reviewed in the United States on April 14, 2020
content: This app is great when it works. Unfortunately the Alexa device fails on occasion to connect to the ourgroceries server or app. Frustrating when you want to dictate an item to your list and it fails. There is nothing wrong with my internet either.

title: Time Saver!
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2018
content: My husband and I share the app.  If I put something on the grocery list it‚Äôs there for him and vise versa. You never know which one of us will stop at the store. No more paper lists!

title: Actually Works
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2017
content: This was the first "skill" we have used that is actually of great use to us (not just a "neat idea" or way to show off Alexia)We maintain several shopping lists since we purchase different items at different vendors. We bought the big box of K-cups at Sam's, fruit at Publix, canned goods at WalMart, etc. My wife always hated having to go to her iPhone to "put things on the list" for me.  Then--with only one list--I would go to each different store when I was there and have to sort through what we picked up there.Now--we can tell Alexia to "tell our groceries to add strawberry yogurt to WalMart" and instantly it populates the correct list. We are finding this extremely helpful.Very cool use of the technology.

title: Doesn't play well with Alexa

content: It's great for those times when I discover I'm out of some or randomly remember an item I need.  If I need more than 1 item it's rather annoying.  Wish list for this Skill:  create new shopping lists and add multiple items.

title: Great start
date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2017
content: The other guy mentioned being able to add multiple items. That would be a big help. You can ask it to add Milk, protein and fruit to Walmart, but it will put all three on the same line. You can add multiples, they just aren't separate. It is very nice to have the items pop up right away though, it's Instant on the phone.

title: A Tad Cumbersome
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2018
content: The app in itself is great.  I much prefer a dedicated shopping list app to the lists portion of the Alexa app.  However, I wish Alexa could learn that OurGroceries is my shopping list app of choice so I could simply say, ‚ÄúAlexa, add (item) to (store).‚Äù  While I‚Äôm wishing, it would also be nice if she could reply, ‚ÄúAnything else?,‚Äù to which I could respond, ‚Äúno,‚Äù or, for example, ‚Äúyes, eggs (pause) milk (pause) bread (pause) ice cream, etc.‚Äù  (The pause would eliminate confusion in the case of multiple-word items.). This, in my opinion, would be the ultimate convenience!

title: Good but not p
date: Reviewed in the United States on July 26, 2018
content: We use this app regularly. Easy and convenient but as others have said it would be better if you didn‚Äôt have to begin with ‚Äúask OurGroceries to add‚Äù. Otherwise I love it.

title: Ask Alexa to "Launch OurGroceries" instead
date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2016
content: The skill works best if you ask Alexa to "launch ourgroceries" first. Also, it won't work if you have the skill on one profile and Alexa is on the other. Ask Alexa to switch profiles and then try again. I've used Our Groceries for years and bring able to add items at the moment I realize I'm out is awesome. Because I usually forget by the time I want to write it down. It gets 5 stars because it still seems to miss and miss understand words frequently enough that it's annoying. Hopefully it's just because it needs time to learn my voice and speech patterns.

title: Works fine
date: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2017
content: Been using OurGroceries app on my phone for years.  Now, when my phone is in the other room i can ask Alexa to add an item.  It would be nice if i could add more than one thing at a time..

title: It's ok
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 2, 2017
content: As a grocery app, it's ok. It can be linked to multiple devices so the whole family can see the list. I changed from another grocery app so that I could use it with Alexa. The other app was better.  It kept track of the amount spent and you could sort the list one way when preparing the list (like by category) and a different way when shopping ( like by aisle). This app only has a single sort. The interface is not very appealing either. It has all the items that I have purchased in a crossed out list at the bottom. I could delete them, but then I have to add back the aisle category every time I add it to the list. My other app stores the item in invisibly until I need it again. I also can't get Alexa to put in quantities. I have to manually change the quantity later, but at least it's on the list.  I love being able to tell Alexa to put items on the list while I'm in the kitchen cooking. That part is very handy.

title: Works like a Charm
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2018
content: It takes a bit to get used to saying, "ask our groceries", but it becomes second nature.I've got lists for each of the stores I frequentIt's great to be able to add to my lists just by asking, and without having to stop what I'm doing

date: Reviewed in the United States on April 11, 2018

title: Great - works exactly as expected.
date: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2017
content: Already being a user of OurGroceries via the Android app as well as the web app, I was ecstatic (seriously - I think I may even have let out a little yelp of joy) to see it had Alexa integration.After getting it setup, I've had no instances of it not working exactly as it should, and adding an item to the list I define.  Something that I think should be made clearer in the description of the skill is that "Shopping List" as noted in the example commands means a list that already exists that you've named "Shopping List".  If you don't use "Shopping List", it can be whatever pre-existing list you've created in the app.Personally, I use OurGroceries for all of my lists (not just groceries), so I have a minor issue that's specific to my usage outside of Alexa - My primary "Groceries" shopping list is named "A2-Groceries" to ensure that it's near the top of my lists while keeping the rest alphabetical.  While I haven't tried asking the Alexa skill to add directly to that list, I have instead added a new list in the app called "Shopping list", which is specifically for Alexa added things so that I can say "Alexa, ask OurGroceries to add cereal to shopping list" as it's easier to remember.

title: Figured It Out, But It Wasn‚Äôt Easy
date: Reviewed in the United States on May 27, 2021
content: We‚Äôve had this app for ages, worked great. Then suddenly it stopped working - everything went to the Alexa list. It took me days to figure out what was happening: we had always said ‚ÄúAlexa, would you ask our groceries to add *** to the shopping list?‚Äù It was added, correctly, no problems. It worked that way for over two years. Then suddenly it wouldn‚Äôt add anything to the Our Groceries Lists, just to the Alexa lists. After hours of fiddling with the thing, the fix was to say EXACTLY, ‚ÄúAlexa, ask our groceries to add *** to the shopping list.‚Äù It now must be said EXACTLY like that. Now it works great!  The instructions and help, of both Alexa and Our Groceries were about as clear as mud and were the most frustrating thing about both. The app works well and is quite helpful: not so much the directions or set-up process - in fact, not at all.
